bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Act:

bcl:text.#text:
means an agreement under section
              6 ;

means an event permit issued under section
              15 ;

means the revenue derived from admission fees to
            a professional contest or exhibition, after the deduction of taxes, and, if prescribed,
            includes revenue derived from the sale of broadcast rights or closed circuit
            distribution rights;
means a licence issued under section 11 ;

means a person who arranges professional contests between
            particular professional athletes for a professional contest or exhibition;

means a person who participates in a professional contest or
            exhibition

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a referee, judge or timekeeper, or
in a prescribed capacity;

bcl:text.#text:
means a person who participates as a contestant
            in a professional contest or exhibition;

means a contest or exhibition of
            professional boxing or another sport prescribed by regulation;

means a person who assists a professional athlete between
            rounds in the course of a professional contest or exhibition.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The minister, by order, may designate as the Athletic Commissioner one of the
          following:

bcl:text.#text: an individual appointed under the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a corporation, if the Lieutenant Governor in Council has approved an
            administrative agreement between the minister and the corporation.

bcl:text.#text:
If the minister makes a designation under section 2 (a), employees may be
            appointed under the  and other persons
            may be retained by the commissioner, whom the commissioner considers necessary to
            exercise the commissioner's powers and perform the commissioner's duties under this
            Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner may delegate, with or without conditions, any of the
            commissioner's powers and duties under this Act to a person or a class of
            persons.
A delegation under subsection (2) must be in writing.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The commissioner is responsible for the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the regulation and supervision of professional contests or exhibitions in
            accordance with this Act and the regulations;
licensing and permitting under this Act;
the enforcement of this Act and the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the commissioner is satisfied that an official has performed, at or in
            respect of a professional contest or exhibition, the services required under the
            regulations or the official's licence, the commissioner must pay the official the
            prescribed amount for performing those services.
Despite subsection (1), officials are not employees of,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if an individual has been designated under section 2 (a), the government,
              and

if a corporation has been designated under section 2 (b), the
              corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The minister may enter into an administrative agreement with a corporation that
            meets the prescribed requirements respecting

bcl:text.#text: the designation under section 2 (b)  of the corporation as the commissioner, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the exercise of the powers and performance of the duties of the commissioner
              under this Act by the corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An administrative agreement must include provisions that specify all of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the expected outcomes to be achieved by the corporation in its capacity as the
              commissioner under this Act;
the performance objectives of the corporation in that capacity;

the acceptance by the corporation of the responsibilities of the
              commissioner;

the terms for financial arrangements between the corporation and the
              government, including

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the collection and payment of fees due to the corporation or the government,
                and
other financial transitional matters;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the uses the corporation may make of administrative penalties paid under this
              Act;
the requirements for records management by the corporation;
the obligation of the corporation in respect of carrying insurance;
indemnification between the corporation and the government;
the obligations of the parties if the agreement is terminated;

the time period of the agreement or the procedure for the review of the
              agreement by the corporation and the government;
procedures for the settlement of disputes;
how the agreement may be terminated by the corporation;

the liability of the corporation arising out of the corporation exercising the
              powers and performing the duties of the commissioner under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The corporation must comply with the terms of the administrative agreement, and
            may not exercise the powers or perform the duties of the commissioner under this Act
            except in accordance with that agreement.

Subject to the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, the minister may
            amend or revoke the administrative agreement without the consent of the corporation if
            the minister gives the corporation prior written notice in accordance with the
            administrative agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Designation does not make corporation an agent of
          government
bcl:section.bcl:text:
If a corporation is designated as the commissioner, the corporation is not an
          agent of the government for the purpose of that designation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power of corporation to set and retain fees

bcl:text.in:desc:
[Lieutenant Governor in Council
              authority to set fees]
bcl:text.#text:
Despite section 47 (2) (b) and (c) , if a corporation is designated as commissioner, the
            corporation may set the fees and charges authorized under section 47 (2) (b) and (c) in
            accordance with subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In setting fees and charges for the purposes of subsection (1), the corporation
            must comply with a fee-setting process that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: established by the corporation, and

in accordance with any criteria established by regulation of the
              minister.

bcl:text.#text:
Fees and charges referred to in subsection (1) do not constitute
            public money under the  and are
            to be collected and retained by the corporation and used to fund the operating costs and
            capital expenditures necessary for the corporation to exercise the powers and perform
            the duties of the commissioner under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Subject to the regulations, a person must not do any of the following unless the
          person holds a valid licence, issued by the commissioner, authorizing the
          activity:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: promote, conduct or hold a professional contest or exhibition;
participate as a contestant in a professional contest or exhibition;

provide services as a judge, matchmaker, referee, second or timekeeper in
            respect of a professional contest or exhibition;
a prescribed activity.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person may apply to the commissioner for a licence by submitting to the
          commissioner

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the information, authorizations and records required by the
            regulations,

the information, application form and other records required by the
            commissioner, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [power of corporation to set and retain fees]
bcl:text.#text:
the fees or other payments required by the regulations or under section
              8 , as
            applicable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, the commissioner may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: issue a licence and impose terms and conditions on the licence,
refuse to issue a licence,
suspend or cancel a licence, or
amend, add to or rescind the terms or conditions of a licence.

bcl:text.#text:
Without limiting the authority of the commissioner under subsection (1), but
            subject to section 19 (2) , the
            commissioner may make a decision under subsection (1) (b), (c) or
              (d)
            if the applicant or licence holder, or, if the applicant or licence holder is a
            corporation, a director or officer of the corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contravenes or has contravened this Act or the regulations,

fails to meet or no longer meets the requirements for the licence as specified
              in the regulations,

contravenes or has contravened a term or condition of a licence or event
              permit,

engages or has engaged in a pattern of conduct that shows, in the
              commissioner's opinion, that the person is unfit to have a licence, or

bcl:text: is or has been convicted of an offence under

for conduct that shows, in the commissioner's opinion, that the person is
              unfit to have a licence.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: this Act or another enactment, or

a law enacted by the government of Canada, another province of Canada or a
                foreign jurisdiction

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting the authority of the commissioner under subsection
              (1), the commissioner may make a decision under subsection (1)
              (b) if the applicant is an employer, employee, officer, director or agent
            of a person against whom the commissioner has made a decision under subsection (1)
              (b) or (c) in respect of the same class of licence for the same
            period.
A licence is not transferable.

A licence holder must immediately give a cancelled licence to the
            commissioner.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are terms and conditions of every licence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the licence holder must comply with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: this Act and the regulations,
the prescribed terms and conditions, and

the terms and conditions imposed on the licence by the
              commissioner;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the licence holder must carry, or have available, the licence at all times when
            engaged in the activity the licence authorizes;

the licence holder, when engaged in the activity the licence authorizes, must
            produce the licence on the request of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an inspector,
a peace officer, or
the commissioner;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the licence holder must report to the commissioner, within 14 days after its
            occurrence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the theft or loss of the licence,

a change in an address required by the application for the licence,
              or
that he or she has been convicted of an offence under

bcl:clause.bcl:text: this Act or another enactment, or

a law enacted by the government of Canada, another province of Canada or a
                foreign jurisdiction.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Subject to the regulations, a person must not promote, conduct or hold a
          professional contest or exhibition unless the person holds a valid event permit, issued by
          the commissioner, authorizing the contest or exhibition.

A person may apply to the commissioner for an event permit by submitting to the
          commissioner

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the information, authorizations and records required by the
            regulations,

the information, application form and other records required by the
            commissioner, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [power of corporation to set and retain fees]
bcl:text.#text:
the fees or other payments required by the regulations or under section
              8 , as
            applicable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Actions by commissioner respecting event permits

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, the commissioner may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
issue an event permit and impose terms and conditions on the event
              permit,
refuse to issue an event permit,
suspend or cancel an event permit, or

amend, add to or rescind the terms or conditions of an event
              permit.

bcl:text.#text:
Without limiting the authority of the commissioner under subsection
              (1), but subject to section 19 (2) , the commissioner may make a decision under subsection (1)
              (b), (c) or (d) if the applicant or event
            permit holder, or, if the applicant or event permit holder is a corporation, a director
            or officer of the corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contravenes or has contravened this Act or the regulations,

fails to meet or no longer meets the minimum requirements for an event permit
              as specified in the regulations,

contravenes or has contravened a term or condition of an event permit or
              licence,

engages or has engaged in a pattern of conduct that shows, in the
              commissioner's opinion, that the person is unfit to have an event permit,
              or

bcl:text: is or has been convicted of an offence under

for conduct that shows, in the commissioner's opinion, that the person is
              unfit to have an event permit.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: this Act or another enactment, or

a law enacted by the government of Canada, another province of Canada or a
                foreign jurisdiction

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting the authority of the commissioner under subsection
              (1), the commissioner may make a decision under subsection (1)
              (b) if the applicant is an employer, employee, officer, director or agent
            of a person against whom the commissioner has made a decision under subsection (1)
              (b) or (c) in respect of the same professional contest or
            exhibition.
An event permit is not transferable.

An event permit holder must immediately give a cancelled event permit to the
            commissioner.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Before issuing an event permit, the commissioner may require the applicant to post
          security, in accordance with the regulations, to ensure compliance with this Act, the
          regulations and the terms and conditions of the event permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An event permit holder must pay to the commissioner an amount not greater than
            5%, as prescribed by regulation, of the gross gate receipts for the professional contest
            or exhibition.

bcl:text: If the commissioner is satisfied that

the commissioner may accept a lesser amount the commissioner considers
            appropriate in the circumstances.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the entire proceeds of a professional contest or exhibition will be used for
              charitable purposes, or

the location or other circumstances of a professional contest or exhibition
              make it inappropriate to impose the fee in the amount prescribed for the purposes of
                subsection
                (1),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An event permit holder must pay the fee under subsection (1) to the
            commissioner in accordance with the regulations.

If the fee payable under this section is not paid as required under subsection
              (3),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the amount of the fee constitutes a debt payable to the commissioner,
              and

the commissioner may file a certificate with the Supreme Court or Provincial
              Court and, on filing, the certificate has the same force and effect, and all
              proceedings may be taken on the certificate, as if it were a judgment of the court
              with which it is filed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A certificate under subsection (4) may be in the prescribed form, must be
            signed by the commissioner and must contain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the person who is liable for payment of the fee,
the date the payment was due, and
the amount of the fee remaining unpaid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Terms and conditions of event permits
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are terms and conditions of every event permit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the event permit holder must comply with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: this Act and the regulations,
the prescribed terms and conditions, and

the terms and conditions imposed on the event permit by the
              commissioner;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the event permit holder must make the event permit available for inspection on
            request of any person at the event;

bcl:text: the event permit holder must ensure that each person who
holds a valid licence for the activity or service.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
performs activities or provides services at or in relation to the professional
              contest or exhibition, and

is required to be licensed under this Act in respect of that activity or
              service

bcl:text.#text:
In this section,  means a licence holder or event
            permit holder, as applicable.

bcl:text:
the commissioner must give the applicant or holder, as applicable, notice and,
            if requested, an opportunity to be heard.

in:desc:
[actions of the
                commissioner respecting event permits]
bcl:text.#text:
makes a decision under section 11 (1) (a)  imposing terms or conditions on a
              licence or under section 15 (1) (a)  imposing terms or conditions on an
              event permit, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
makes a decision under section 11 (1) (c) or (d) or 15 (1) (c)
              or (d),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite subsection (2), if the commissioner considers it necessary in the public
            interest, the commissioner, immediately, without notice and before giving the holder an
            opportunity to be heard, may make a decision under section 11 (1) (c) or (d) or
              15 (1)
              (c) or (d).

As soon as practicable after taking action under subsection (3), the commissioner
            must give the holder notice in writing of the decision and of the right of the holder to
            request an opportunity to be heard under this section.

bcl:text.#text:
A request under subsection (2) or (4) must be made within 30 days
            after the date the notice is considered received by the applicant or holder, as
            applicable, in accordance with section 44 .

bcl:text:
the commissioner may rescind or temporarily rescind the action taken under
              subsection
              (3).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
is made within 15 days after the date the notice is considered received by the
              holder in accordance with section 44, and
is accompanied by a written reply,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner must not act under subsection (6) unless the
            commissioner is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the written reply sets out facts or arguments that, if confirmed, would
              establish reasonable grounds for the commissioner to rescind, vary or substitute the
              decision under subsection (3), and
it is reasonable to conclude that,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
unless the commissioner rescinds or temporarily rescinds the decision, the
                person against whom the action under subsection (3) was taken
                will suffer a significant loss as a result of that action, and

if the commissioner rescinds or temporarily rescinds the decision, no
                person's health or safety will be placed at risk.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner must provide an opportunity to be heard within 30 days after
            receiving a request under subsection (2) or (4) unless the written reply
            under subsection (6) causes the commissioner to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rescind the decision under subsection (3), and

make another decision in respect of which the commissioner is not required
              under subsection (2) or (4) to provide notice.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner must give the applicant or holder, as applicable, written
            reasons for the following decisions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a decision under section 11 (1) (a) imposing terms or conditions on a
              licence;
a decision under section 11 (b), (c) or (d);

a decision under section 15 (1) (a) imposing terms or conditions on
              an event permit;
a decision under section 15 (b), (c) or (d).

bcl:text.#text:
For certainty, the commissioner need not provide an opportunity to be heard
            under this section in respect of the suspension of a licence or event permit under
              section 30
              (3) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner may designate persons or persons within a class of persons as
              inspectors.

The commissioner may impose restrictions on the powers and duties that an
              inspector may carry out under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
An inspector may conduct an inspection for one or both of the following
            purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
determining compliance with this Act, the regulations or the terms and
              conditions of a licence or event permit;
assessing an applicant for a licence or event permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of an inspection under section 21, an inspector may
              do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: inquire into any business, affairs or conduct of a person;

inspect, audit or examine any record or other thing in the
                premises;

require that any person who has possession or control of a record or other
                thing in the premises produce the record or thing;

make a record, including a record on film, audio tape, video tape or
                otherwise, of the premises, or of anything in or on the premises;

remove any record or other thing from the premises for the purpose of making
                copies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
On the request of an inspector, a peace officer may assist the inspector in
              carrying out an inspection.

If any record or thing is removed under subsection (1) (f), the
              inspector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may make copies of, take extracts from or otherwise record it,
                and
must give a receipt to the person from whom it is taken.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The inspection powers under subsection (1) must not be
              used to enter a private dwelling except with the consent of the occupant.

The inspector, on request of a person whose premises the inspector enters,
              must produce identification provided by the commissioner for this purpose.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Subject to the regulations, an inspector, within a reasonable time, must return
            to the person from whom it was taken any record or thing removed in the course of an
            inspection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an inspector concludes in the course of an inspection under this Act that
              the inspector has reasonable grounds to believe that a person has contravened or is
              contravening this Act, the regulations or the terms or conditions of a licence or
              event permit, the inspector may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
order a person to do anything the inspector considers necessary to stop the
                contravention or prevent another contravention, and

seize anything validly inspected by the inspector that the inspector
                believes on reasonable grounds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was used or is being used in the contravention, or
will afford evidence of the contravention.

bcl:text.#text:
Sections 23 (4) and 24 to 24.2 of the  apply in respect of anything seized under subsection (1) of
              this section and, for the purposes of section 23 (4) of the , an inspector is deemed to be a peace officer.

If, under section 24 (2) (a) of the , a justice orders that something referred to in subsection
              (2) of this section be detained, despite section 24 (3) of the , the thing may be detained for up to one
              year before an order under section 24 (5) of that Act, authorizing its continued
              detention, is required.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
After giving a person notice, and, if requested, an opportunity to be heard,
              the commissioner may impose an administrative penalty on the person if the person
              contravenes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations, or
a term or condition of a licence or event permit.

bcl:text.#text:
A request under subsection (1) must be made within 30 days after the
              date the notice is considered received by the person in accordance with section
                44 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Before the commissioner imposes an administrative penalty on a person, the
              commissioner must consider the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: previous enforcement actions against the person under this Act;
the gravity and magnitude of the contravention;

the extent of the harm to others resulting from the
                contravention;
whether the contravention was repeated or continuous;
whether the contravention was deliberate;

any economic benefit derived by the person from the
                contravention;
the person's efforts to correct the contravention.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The commissioner may not impose an administrative penalty on a person if the
              person demonstrates to the satisfaction of the commissioner that the person exercised
              due diligence to prevent the contravention.

If a corporation contravenes a provision of this Act or the regulations
              prescribed for the purposes of subsection (1) (a) or a term or condition of a
              licence or event permit, an officer, director or agent of the corporation who
              authorized, permitted or acquiesced in the contravention is also liable under this
              section, whether or not an administrative penalty is imposed on the
              corporation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Effect of charging an offence or imposing administrative
            penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who has been charged with an offence under this Act may not be
              subject to an administrative penalty in respect of the circumstances that gave rise to
              the charge.

If the commissioner imposes an administrative penalty on a person, a
              prosecution for an offence under this Act for the same contravention may not be
              brought against the person.

An individual on whom an administrative penalty is imposed is liable to a
              penalty of not more than $10 000.

A corporation on which an administrative penalty is imposed is liable to a
              penalty of not more than $100 000.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), a person on whom or which
              an administrative penalty is imposed in respect of an event permit is liable to a
              penalty of not more than 25% of the gross gate receipts for the event.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
If the commissioner imposes an administrative penalty on a person, the
            commissioner must serve on the person a notice imposing the administrative penalty that
            specifies the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention;
the amount of the penalty;
the date by which the penalty must be paid.

bcl:text.#text:
The person on whom an administrative penalty is imposed must pay the
            administrative penalty within 30 days after the date on which the notice referred to in
              section
              28 is considered received in accordance with section 44 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
On the date that an administrative penalty is payable under section 29
              the administrative penalty constitutes a debt payable to the commissioner by the
              person on whom the penalty is imposed.

If a person fails to pay an administrative penalty as required under section
              29, the commissioner may file with the Supreme Court or Provincial Court a
              certified copy of the notice imposing the administrative penalty and, on being filed,
              the notice has the same force and effect, and all proceedings may be taken on the
              notice, as if it were a judgment of the court with which it is filed.

If a person fails to pay an administrative penalty as required under section
              29, the commissioner may suspend a licence or event permit held by the
              person until the administrative penalty is paid.

bcl:text.#text:
If the commissioner is designated under section 2
                (a) , the
              commissioner must pay all amounts derived from administrative penalties into the
              consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the commissioner is designated under section 2 (b), the commissioner
              must use amounts derived from administrative penalties in accordance with the
              administrative agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The time limit for giving a notice imposing an administrative penalty is 2 years
            after the date on which the contravention occurred.

bcl:text.#text: In this Division,  means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a decision of the commissioner

bcl:text.#text:
imposing terms or conditions on a licence under section 11 (1)
                  (a) ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
refusing to issue a licence under section 11 (1)
                (b),

suspending or cancelling a licence under section 11 (1)
                (c),

bcl:text.in:desc:
[actions by commissioner in respecting event
                  permits]
bcl:text.#text:
imposing terms or conditions on an event permit under section 15 (1)
                  (a) ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
refusing to issue an event permit under section 15 (1) (b),
                or

suspending or cancelling an event permit under section 15 (1)
                (c),

bcl:text.#text: a notice under section 28  imposing an administrative penalty, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed decision of the commissioner.

bcl:text.#text:
A person who receives written reasons under section 19
                (9)  in respect of a
              determination or notice under section 28  may request the commissioner to reconsider the determination,
              which request must be made

bcl:text.in:desc:
[when documents are considered to be
                  received]
bcl:text.#text:
within 30 days after receiving in accordance with section
                  44  reasons for the decision or the notice, as applicable,
                or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
within the period of time specified by the commissioner, if the commissioner
                is satisfied that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
special circumstances existed which precluded the filing of a request for
                  reconsideration within the period of time required in paragraph
                    (a) of this subsection, and
an injustice would otherwise result.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A request under subsection (1) must be in writing and must identify
              the error the person believes was made or the other grounds on which the
              reconsideration is requested.
For the purposes of a reconsideration, the commissioner

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
has all the powers and duties the commissioner had with respect to the
                determination, and
may confirm, vary or cancel the determination.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The person who made a determination may not be permitted to perform the
              reconsideration of the determination.

bcl:text.#text:
The commissioner must serve the decision on reconsideration, and written
              reasons for the decision, on the person who made the request under section 34
                (1) .

Section 5 of the  does not apply to this Act
          or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:text.#text: section 9 (a), (b), (c) or (d) ;

section
                13 ;
section 17 (1) or (3) ;

a term or condition described in section 18 (a) (i), (ii) or (iii), (b) or
                (c) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
subsection
                (4) (a), (b), (c) or (d) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who fails to comply with a requirement of the regulations commits an
            offence.

bcl:text.#text:
A person who fails to comply with an order of an inspector under section 24 (1)
              (a)  commits an
            offence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
supply false or misleading information to a person acting under this
              Act;
refuse or fail to provide information as required under this Act;
obstruct, hinder or interfere with an inspection under this Act;
purport to have a licence when the person does not.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person does not commit an offence under subsection (4) (a) if, at the
            time the information was supplied, the person did not know that the information was
            false or misleading and, with the exercise of reasonable diligence, could not have known
            that the information was false or misleading.

If an offence under subsection (4) (c) continues for more than one day,
            the offender is liable to a separate penalty, without notice and without a separate
            count being laid, for each day that the contravention occurs.

If a corporation commits an offence under this Act, an employee, officer,
            director or agent of the corporation who authorizes, permits or acquiesces in the
            commission of the offence also commits an offence, whether or not the corporation is
            prosecuted for the offence.

In a prosecution for an offence under this Act, it is sufficient proof of the
            offence to establish that the offence was committed by an employee, officer, director or
            agent of the defendant, whether or not the employee, officer, director or agent is
            identified or has been prosecuted for the offence.

Subsection
              (8) does not apply if the defendant establishes that the defendant
            exercised due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence.

An individual who commits an offence against this Act is liable to a fine of not
            more than $10 000 or to imprisonment for not more than 12 months or to both.

A corporation that commits an offence against this Act is liable to a fine of
            not more than $100 000.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), the court may increase a fine imposed under this
            section by an amount of up to 3 times the court's estimation of the amount of monetary
            benefit acquired or accrued as a result of the commission of the offence.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The time limit for laying information for an offence under this Act is 2 years
          after the time when the subject matter of the proceeding arose.

in:desc: [power to prohibit professional contests and exhibitions]
bcl:text.#text:
A bylaw under section 59 (1) (f)  of the  or section
            338  of
          the  prohibiting professional contests or
          exhibitions to which this Act applies does not apply to any professional contest or
          exhibition in respect of which an event permit has been issued under this Act before the
          date the bylaw comes into force.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
An opportunity to be heard under this Act may be provided in writing,
          electronically or orally or by any combination of written, electronic or oral hearings as
          determined by the commissioner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who is engaged in the administration of this Act or the regulations and
            who has custody of, access to or control over information or records under this Act must
            not disclose the information or records to any other person except

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if disclosure is for the purposes of the administration of this
              Act,

with the consent of the person to whom the information or record
              relates,

in court proceedings related to this Act or other similar enactments of a
              province or Canada,
if an enactment of a province or Canada requires the disclosure,
to the person's counsel,
to a law enforcement agency, or
under an agreement with the government.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The person referred to in subsection (1) is not, except in a proceeding under
            this Act, compellable to disclose or give evidence about information or records the
            person has custody of, access to or control over.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How to give or serve documents generally
bcl:section.bcl:text:
All documents that are required or permitted under this Act to be given or served
          on a person must be given or served in one of the following ways:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by leaving a copy with the person;
if the person to be served is not the commissioner,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by leaving a copy with an agent of that person,

by sending a copy by ordinary mail or registered mail to the address at which
              that person carries on business,

by leaving a copy in a mailbox or mail slot for the address at which that
              person carries on business,

by attaching a copy to a door or other conspicuous place at the address at
              which that person carries on business, or

by sending a copy by electronic mail to the electronic mail address provided
              by that person;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person to be served is the commissioner,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by leaving a copy with an agent of the commissioner,

by sending a copy by ordinary mail or registered mail to the address of the
              office of the commissioner, or

by sending a copy by electronic mail to the electronic mail address provided
              by the commissioner;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
by transmitting a copy to a facsimile number provided by the person as an
            address for service.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A document given or served in accordance with section 43 is deemed to be
          received as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if given or served by sending a copy by mail, on the 5th day after it is
            mailed;

if given or served by leaving a copy in a mailbox or mail slot, on the 3rd day
            after it is left;

if given or served by attaching a copy to a door or other conspicuous place, on
            the 3rd day after it is attached;

if given or served by transmitting a copy by facsimile or sending a copy by
            electronic mail, on the 3rd day after it is transmitted or sent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If it is necessary in a proceeding to prove that a person has been designated by
            the minister as the commissioner, a certificate purporting to be signed by the minister
            is proof of the fact so stated.

A statement respecting any of the following and purporting to be signed by the
            commissioner is proof of the facts stated in the statement for all purposes in a
            proceeding:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the existence, non-existence or status of a licence or an event
              permit;
the designation of a person as an inspector;

the filing with or submission to the commissioner of information or a
              record.

bcl:text.#text: The minister may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the minister may make regulations as
            follows:

bcl:text.#text:
prescribing the requirements that a corporation must meet to be eligible for
              an administrative agreement under section 6 ;

bcl:text.in:desc:
[power of corporation to set and retain
              fees]
bcl:text.#text:
establishing criteria for the purposes of section 8 (2)
                (b) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing other activities for which a licence is required;
respecting licences, including, without limitation, prescribing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
information, authorizations and records that must be provided on application
                for a licence,
eligibility criteria,
terms and conditions of licences, and
forms of licences;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting event permits, including, without limitation,
              prescribing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
information, authorizations and records that must be provided on application
                for an event permit,
eligibility criteria,
terms and conditions of event permits, and
forms of event permits;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting security in relation to event permits, including, without
              limitation, prescribing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount, or maximum amount, of security that may be required,
the forms of the security that may be provided, and
the circumstances under which the security may be realized;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting records, books and accounts to be kept by holders of licences and
              event permits;

requiring holders of licences and event permits to provide information to the
              commissioner at the times and in the manner directed by the commissioner;

establishing standards for refereeing, judging or matchmaking for professional
              contests or exhibitions;

regulating or prohibiting the use of specified equipment during weigh-ins and
              professional contests or exhibitions;

respecting the safety of participants, officials and others at professional
              contests or exhibitions;

respecting medical examinations for professional athletes and the availability
              of medical assistance during professional contests or exhibitions;

providing for the drug and alcohol testing of professional athletes on a
              random basis or otherwise;

regulating the conduct of professional athletes and other participants in
              professional contests or exhibitions;

requiring that the officials for a professional contest or exhibition be
              designated by the commissioner;

respecting the payment of officials who participate in a professional contest
              or exhibition, including, without limitation, prescribing the amounts officials must
              be paid.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1) or (2), the minister may make
            regulations as follows:

bcl:text.#text:
requiring event permit holders to deliver to the commissioner, before a
              professional contest or exhibition takes place, the amount required to be paid to
              officials under section 5 (1)  in respect of the professional contest or exhibition,
              including requiring that that amount be paid with the fee payable for the event
              permit;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing payments for broadcast rights or closed circuit distribution
              rights as included in the definition of "gross gate receipts";

respecting the return of records or things removed during an
              inspection;

bcl:text.#text:
respecting payment of the fee under section 17
                (3) ;

applying provisions of the  to the commissioner as if the commissioner were
              a tribunal;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing rules the minister considers necessary to ensure the fairness of
              professional contests or exhibitions;

defining for the purposes of this Act any word or expression used but not
              specifically defined in this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), (2) or (3), the
            minister may make regulations authorizing the commissioner to publish information
            respecting a person in relation to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
actions taken in respect of the person's licence or event permit, including
              the reasons for the action,

imposing an administrative penalty on the person, including the nature of the
              contravention and the amount of the penalty, and

convictions for offences under this Act, including specifying the offence and
              the penalty.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section
            41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
            make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing fees and charges for the purposes of this Act, including fees and
              charges in respect of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: applications made under this Act;
licences and event permits;
holding professional contests or exhibitions;

bcl:text.#text:
establishing the percentage of gross gate receipts for the purposes of
                section
                17 , which percentage may be
              different in respect of amounts paid for the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: admission to a venue;

if prescribed for the purposes of the definition of "gross gate receipts",
                broadcast rights or closed circuit distribution rights;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting administrative penalties, including, without limitation,

bcl:text.#text:
prescribing provisions of this Act and the regulations for the purposes of
                  section
                  25 (1) (a) ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
authorizing administrative penalties to be imposed on a daily basis for
                contraventions that continue for, or occur on, 2 or more consecutive days,
                and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
exempting any class of person or professional contest or exhibition from any
              provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Regulations under this Act

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may be different for different classes of applications, activities, professional
            athletes, event permits, licences, officials, persons, venues, professional contests or
            exhibitions and may establish classes for that purpose,

bcl:text.#text:
for the purposes of regulations under section 46 (2) or (3) , may adopt by
            reference, in whole or in part and with any changes the minister considers necessary,
            any regulation, code, standard or rule

bcl:text:
as the regulation, code, standard or rule stands at a specific date, as it stands
            at the time of adoption or as amended from time to time, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
enacted as or under a law of another jurisdiction, including a foreign
              jurisdiction, or

set by a provincial, national or international code, standard or rule making
              body,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may delegate a matter to or confer a discretion on the commissioner.

bcl:text.#text:
Without limiting section 47, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make
          regulations considered necessary or advisable for the orderly transition from athletic
          commissions established under section 143 (2) of the  or Part XIX of the  to the commissioner under this Act, including, without
          limitation,

continuing licences issued by an athletic commission established under the
               or the  and specifying when those licences terminate,
            and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
requiring an athletic commission referred to in paragraph (a) to transfer to the
            commissioner records respecting licences issued by the commission.

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: See Table of Legislative Changes for the status of sections 50 and 51.]

bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in
          Council.
